DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety performance balloon-expandable Zeus CC ( Rontis AG ) stent treatment Trans-Atlantic Inter-Society Consensus ( TASC ) A , B , C D iliac lesion .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Performance Zeus CC Stent Treatment Iliac Occlusive Disease
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient old 18 year 2 . Patient must sign write informed consent form approve ethic committee prior indexprocedure 3 . Patient must compliant followup visit 4 . Patient suffers intermittent claudication ( Rutherford 13 ) critical limb ischemia ( Rutherford 4 5 ) 5 . Patient 's life expectancy 2 year 6 . Patient iliac atherosclerotic de novo lesion ( ) type A , B , C & D accord TASCII classification 7 . Target vessel diameter 5 9 mm 8 . Target lesion baseline diameter stenosis 50 % 9 . Patient sufficient infrainguinal runoff least patent common femoral artery deep femoral artery ( < 50 % stenosis ) 1 . Patient life expectancy le 2 year 2 . Patient refuse compliant followup visit 3 . Patient suffers acute limb ischemia , define sudden decrease limb perfusion cause potential threat limb viability . 4 . Patient intolerant anticoagulant antiplatelet therapy aspirin , heparin , clopidogrel ticlopidine drug therapy 5 . Patient already treat stent ipsilateral target vessel 6 . Patient suffer tissue loss target extremity , define Rutherford 6 7 . Patient already enrol another investigational device study 8 . Patient coronary intervention within last 60 day enrolment study plan coronary intervention within 60 day enrolment study 9 . Use alternative therapy ( e.g . atherectomy , cut balloon , laser , radiation therapy ) part indexprocedure 10 . Any planned surgical intervention within 30 day indexprocedure 11 . Patient abdominal aortic aneurysm likely require repair within next 2 year . 12 . Patient sufficient infrainguinal runoff ( > 50 % stenosis ) . Patient inclusion possible revascularization ( endovascular surgical ) perform procedure peroperative angiographic control yield < 30 % stenosis . 13 . Target lesion restenotic lesion . 14 . Target lesion adjacent aneurysm . 15 . Target vessel perforation document contrast extravasation indexprocedure prior stent placement .
